stories.title: Glyphtracer – convert images of letters to a font

stories.text:
Do entities like ESPN, NCAA, etc. crack down on illegal sports streams? And if so how is it technically possible?

As an American who has emigrated to a foreign country I get a lot of mileage out of googling "free sport streams" when I want to watch my favorite games.

I've noticed that the more popular a game is, i.e. the super bowl or the final four, the more difficult it is to find a working stream for. This leads me to believe there is some effort on part of entities like ESPN and the NCAA to crack down on these 'illegal' streams.

Thanks !
stories.title: Do entities like ESPN, NCAA, etc. crack down on illegal sports streams?

I recently launched Scriptbar-snippets.tryapp.us, a website listing developer handy snippets e.g turn any website to dark mode, pretty print minified css, inject any library to current page, ...

Would love to hear your feedback!!
stories.title: Show HN: Scriptbar Snippets – Handy code snippet to save in the browser

stories.text:
There are certain materials (some metal oxides, I think) which adapt to external stimulus quite like sentient beings.
Does anyone know of such materials?
stories.title: Decision Making by Inanimate Objects?
